title: profiles.ini file not doing what I need it to (and it used to)
content:
I access my Tbird profile from different devices. My old laptop self-destructed, so I need to configure a new one. The profile I use in on a central server, so I need to have the laptop find it.

What always worked for me in the past was to edit profile.ini, in ...Appdata/Roaming/Thunderbird which currently looks like:

[InstallD78BF5DD33499EC2] Default=Profiles/ibbgujfs.default-release Locked=1

[Profile1] Name=default IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/p3uryki2.default Default=1

[Profile0] Name=default-release IsRelative=1 Path=Profiles/ibbgujfs.default-release

[Profile2] Name=Central-Store IsRelative=0 Path=//NEW-HUB/F/TbirdDad

[General] StartWithLastProfile=1 Version=2

Central-store is the one I need to use. But when I go to Troubleshooting / about-profiles it does not show up.

And just to be clear, it is useless for me (or anyone) to destroy, move or replicate the profile data without losing coherent access from more than one device.
creator: JonathanWexler

title: Supernova upgrade displaces subfolders
content:
Up to and including Thunderbird 102, I have a number of emails and use the View Unified. I use vertical panes - left hand pane is all the inbox, sent, archives folders etc. Under Archives is my @gmail address only, and under this I have created a large number of subfolders for various subjects both work and personal related. Its worked great for years - since Thunderbird 60 versions.

When I upgrade to the 15 version (SuperNova) it keeps splitting all my archived subfolders. It leave approx half of them in the same Archive/@gmail address and then further down the pane it creates a new @gmail address folder and puts the rest of my subfolders in there.

I know it doesn't sound too drastic, and as far as I can tell nothing is missing, but it now makes me have to scroll and toggle open the two @gmail address folders to find, sort and use my subfolders and its very inconvenient especially as it goes off the bottom of the screen.

Whats going on and is there a cure for this please? I like the new look of Supernova but I hate using it to the point that I uninstalled it and reinstalled 102 and copied across my baked up profile folder to restore it. I did this for 15.1 and today for 15.2 (I hoped they had fixed it but Not).
creator: symetec

title: Thunderbird 115.2 access to Google calendar formatted as Mozilla
content:
I support two family users of Thunderbird 115.2 who have both installed access to my Google calendar.

After providing access to that Google calendar on both PCs, the calendar is shown formatted by Thunderbird, that is without colors etc as formatted when accessing the calendar as a webpage via Mozzilla. A) On my machine, if I close my calendar page within Thunderbird, and option to access my google calendar appears at top line of T'bird screen. That leads me to a calendar page formatted similar to a webpage view of that calendar. I can. for example, insert and see color detail on a calendar entry. B) On the other PC - my wife's - that option does not appear and access to the Google calendar is shown with only Thunderbird formats - none of the color detail added on other interfaces such as my PC via T'bird calendar function, or simply web page access via Mozilla.

I'm puzzled about the difference between those installation - A and B. How can I get "B" to function like A ?

I suspect there may be a residue of earlier changes to synchronise T'bird and the Google calendar.
creator: jimboyle

title: Lost folders, lost messages and double folders
content: I have Thunderbird e-mail manager. In my Gmail account, which I have installed in Thunderbird (perigreece@gmail.com), I see three trash cans and many double, triple and so on folders, of the format "Folder", "Folder 1", "Folder 2" etc. Also, when I delete a message, I can't find it in any of the three bins. I also don't see my Spam e-mails. Instead, when I log in from my webmail, I see the deleted e-mails that I delete through webmail in the bin and not the ones I delete through Thunderbird. At the same time, I still see the duplicate, triple and so on folders in my webmail as well. How could I find a solution to this issue? I await your response and thank you very much in advance!
creator: perigreece

title: strange behavior
content:
I run Thunderbird on my MacBook Pro and have it process several accounts. One of those accounts has developed a strange problem. Every time it checks the server for messages it downloads a message - the same message every time. It has been doing this for several days. If I check this account from another device I will see (and download) new messages. But the new messages do not show up in this account. I stopped and started Thunderbird - problem persists. I shut down and rebooted the laptop - problem persists. I upgraded to newest version - problem persists. Any ideas what causes this? And even more important a suggestion of how to resolve this?

edit -----------

After posting the question I looked at several other posts which presented similar type issues. One suggested going to the account in webmail, finding the oldest message, delete that message, and the problem resolves. I did that, used webmail, deleted the oldest message, now the account works as expected. Done know what caused it but glad that it is now working again.

content:
Hi - I am using Thunderbird to migrate to and from Proton Mail. I'm using Proton Mail Bridge as part of this system. I've added two emails to Thunderbird and it was successful. Then, when I try to copy one email from one account to the other, I'm getting this error message:

The current command did not succeed. The mail server for account [email address] responded; failed to prepare message for import; failed to encrypt message -; gopenpgp: error in encrypting asymmetrically: open pgpg: invalud argument: cannot encrypt a message to key id because it has no valid encryption keys.

title: Windows 7 Laptop to Windows 10 Laptop Thunderbird
content: When I converted to Thunderbird last March I had issues moving from MS Outlook 2010. May problem now the information that David shared with me I am unable to match in Windows 10. I have emails that I saved in this file that I need. I would GREATLY APPRECIATE any and all help from the community!! Thanks Richard Germain
creator: rdg_tech

title: Initial message display
content:
When Thunderbird went to the new GUI, the initial Inbox display changed. It used to be it would display the most recent email(s), the emails just retrieved. Now Thunderbird "jumps" to a random spot in older emails in the Inbox.

Now the display seems to start at a random point in the Inbox. For example, I get 5 new emails today (day 12/14/23) and I see the popup that says there are new emails. When I open/click on the Inbox, the display is at emails from, for example, 11/2/23.

I can't find a consistent point "back" in my emails the program seems to jump to. It just doesn't display the most recent emails as the default starting place as the Inbox is opened.

The "jump to" point isn't the last unread or unopened email.

The "jump to" point isn't a highlighted or tagged message.

The "jump to" point isn't the same each time chronologically.

I'd like Thunderbird to display my Inbox oldest at the top and newest at the bottom of the display and the newest be where the display is when I open the Inbox. It used to work that way and doesn't now.

I may not be searching using the right words or names but has anyone else experienced this and, if so, is there a "fix" to return to the older display preference?
creator: rustyhaight

title: threaded messages

title: Thunderbird cannot get Google approval
content:
I install Thunderbird. I define my GMaul account I get a screen from Google that says "Mozilla Thunderbird Email wants to access your Google Account null dougcantreademail@gmail.com This will allow Mozilla Thunderbird Email to: and I get three heading labels. I open the labels.

More info Read, compose, send, and permanently delete all your email from Gmail Click for more information More info See, edit, download, and permanently delete your contacts Click for more information More info See, edit, share, and permanently delete all the calendars you can access using Google Calendar Click for more information By clicking Allow, you allow this app and Google to use your information in accordance with their respective privacy policies. You can change this and other Account Permissions at any time.

I open each and say OK to each. The OK doesn't change or enable anything and that means I cannot get Google approval for Thunderbird to get mail from my e-mail account.

Something has to be fixed but I have no idea what and I'm very sure there is nothing I can do to fix the problem. There is no overall "OK" or "Agree" or some such button.

As far as I can see, this is between your product and Google. Either you are calling up a bad page or Google is screwed up and they need to hear it from YOU.

Until this gets fixed, I cannot use Thunderbird.

I contributed.

Doug Ray
creator: DougCantReadEMail

title: Preserving local e-mail files while clearing IMAP server files
content:
Long ago, I signed-up for Thunderbird as a POP service and have not looked at that until I see a warning that I have used 76% of my allocated IMAP space.

So, now that I somehow have IMAP, I am reading to learn about it. My understanding is that everything in my "Inbox" is automatically synced with files stored on the IMAP server, so that deleting them on one deletes them on both. Correct?

I have a large amount of e-mails that I "moved" to "Local Folders" and subfolders under that. I did not "copy" them to the local folder, I "move" them.

So, my first question is whether "moving" a file from my "Inbox" to my "local folders" has removed that file from my IMAP server?

If so, what I will probably do to free-up space on the IMAP server is to move e-mails remaining in my "Inbox" to a "local folders" subfolder marked something like "from inbox" to keep them locally available, but get them off the IMAP server. Will that work as I intend? To keep things simple, I will probably do that in batches, periodically, for all e-mails in the "inbox" that are older than some amount of time in the past.
creator: steve.long4

title: Thunderbird -- Changes to files (size increase) on 11/30/2023
content:
My backup tool blew up due to 1000's of Thunderbird files being modified.

I can't tell if this was due to some kind of malware, or if Version 115.5.1 of Thunderbird went through the database/file structure and wholesale modified everything. If the former, I don't want to backup the files (yes, I have run BitDefender of the profile structure: all 125K files and it comes up clean). If the latter, and everything is operating as normal/expected, then I do. I have seen no issues with the operation of Thunderbird (which I love, BTW).

So, did Thunderbird change 1000's files that were otherwise not accessed by me? (see example in attachment)

I am currently running the Version 115.5.2 (64-bit) / December 11, 2023. I presume this event followed shortly after the installation of "Version 115.5.1, first offered to channel users on November 27, 2023."
creator: jonathan67
